intro: Urachne sphacelata, commonly known as the narrowleaf urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, and the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Urachne sphacelata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
